intro: Psydrax lepidus, commonly known as the silky psychotria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and potential ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
